Comments_List: I learned a lot about the history of agriculture.
Plenty; it was a VERY thorough deep dive into agriculture and civilization, past to present.
There were no weaknesses. It was a great course.

The strengths lie in the reading list and Professor Weiss' ability to speak to the topics. The weakness is, if you don't like Weiss' way of lecturing, you won't get nearly as much satisfaction out of the course. Personally, I really enjoyed him.
I would. It's a great course.

Yes - I think this is a course / content that everyone should be required to take. Food is the main building block of everything, and it's a peculiar time in food science/industry/etc. 

The reading is GREAT, and the professor is truly qualified. I absolutely loved the course.
